intro: Desmoscelis lychnitoides, commonly known as the candlewax plant, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, showy bracts that resemble candles. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pale pink to white in color. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or coastal areas. Due to its unique appearance, it is sometimes cultivated for ornamental purposes.
